evidence.text: Johnson v. Miller, 864 F. Supp. 1354, 1393 (S.D. Ga. 1994), aff’d and remanded Miller v. Johnson, 515 U.S. 900 (1995)

extracted.value: Johnson v. Miller, 864 F. Supp. 1354, 1393 (S.D. Ga. 1994), aff’d and remanded Miller v. Johnson, 515 U.S. 900 (1995)

evidence.text: Defendants advised the Court on January 27, 2023 of their intention to file an appeal and requested a stay of the Court's January 6, 2023 order.

extracted.value: Appeal: Defendants appealed to United States Supreme Court.

evidence.text: For the reasons set forth below, the Court grants in part and denies in part the motion.

extracted.value: Grants in part and denies in part defendants’ motion to stay the portion of the court’s January 6, 2023 order.

evidence.text: The court denied the motion, finding that defendants had failed to carry their burden, under Nken v. Holder, 556 U.S. 418, 434 (2009), of showing a strong likelihood of success on the merits, irreparable injury, and that a stay was the public interest.

extracted.value: Denies defendants’ motion to stay the court’s January 6, 2023 order, finding that defendants failed to carry their burden under Nken v. Holder.

evidence.text: The court hereby exercises its authority under Rule 62(d) to modify its injunction to preserve the status quo on appeal.

extracted.value: Modifies the court’s injunction to preserve the status quo on appeal.

evidence.text: The court hereby enjoins the conducting of an election under Congressional District No. 1 until a constitutionally valid apportionment plan is approved by this Court.

extracted.value: Enjoins elections in Congressional District No. 1 until a constitutionally valid apportionment plan is approved.

evidence.text: The court DENIES the Motions to Dismiss (ECF Nos. 91 and 158).

extracted.value: Denies the motions to dismiss as outlined in Order (002), (ECF Nos. 91 and 158).

evidence.text: MOTION to Appear Pro Hac Vice by John M. Gore ( Filing fee $ 350 receipt number 0420-10137675) by Harvey Peeler, Luke A Rankin. Response to Motion due by 11/3/2021.

extracted.value: Harvey Peeler and Luke A Rankin filed a Motion to Appear Pro Hac Vice on 10/20/2021, requesting permission to appear as counsel.
